title: Sampler, 1802
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Abigail Pearson sampler wrought in the twelfth year of her age 1802
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Bought at Newburyport from Mrs. Wigglesworth.
creditline: Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers
description: Two fragments of a long sampler stitched together, embroidered in black, green and yellow on a darkened linen ground.  The top half has alphabets and the inscription with a floral vine border; the lower half has many horizontal bands of simple stitches and patterns, and an alphabet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1802.
1802. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers. 2003-14-22-a,b.
